text: In probability theory, Bienaymé's identity states that :\operatorname{Var}(S_n) = \sum_{k=1}^n \operatorname{Var}(X_k), where X_1, \ldots, X_n are pairwise independent integrable random variables with finite second moments and S_n = \sum_{k=1}^n X_k. Bienaymé's identity may be used in proving certain variants of the law of large numbers. == References == Category:Algebra of random variables
title: Bienaymé's identity
